title: Alternatives to Rotis
content:
(I've submitted the same topic under 'General Discussion')  
Hey typophiles! I thank you in advance...

I’m redesigning a logo for one of my clients, which was set in Book Antiqua and has a very clunky outdated symbol. I’m getting rid of the symbol and focusing on the typeface. I’m redesigning the logo with Rotis semi-serif and I wanted to customize some of the letterforms, so trademark Rotis letters like ’e’, ’c’ will be different from the original typeface.  
Does anyone have any good alternative suggestions?
author: Jon Evenchen

comments.content: How about [FF Wunderlich](http://web.archive.org/web/20141117105929/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Wunderlich&x=21&y=11)? (Rather similar to the semi-sans, though.)

ooo Wuderlich is a great looking typeface. A good, subtle alternative to Optima...I might be able to work with this even though I need something slightly more serify...Thanks Jan!

JonE.
